noun.description: A member of an ancient people who lived in Chaldea c.800 BC and ruled Babylonia 625–539 BC. They were renowned as astronomers and astrologers.
The Semitic language of the ancient Chaldeans.
A member of a Syrian Uniate (formerly Nestorian) Church based mainly in Iran and Iraq.

adjective.description: Relating to ancient Chaldea or its people or language.
Relating to the East Syrian Uniate Church.
